poem:
The Seizure  

In Gaza's grasp, dust swirls,  
boots push through sand—  
a territory held firm,  
stories of refuge scatter,  
like figs fallen from branches  
in a distant, uprooted orchard.  
Words, like stones,  
build walls and wound,  
while under the sky's  
unforgiving eye,  
the land breathes  
in tense stillness.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Netanyahu says new offensive in Gaza focused on consolidating seizure of territory Benjamin Netanyahu, Israel’s prime minister, has said a new “intensified” offensive in Gaza will involve Israeli troops holding on to seized territory and significant displacement of the population. Speaking after officials said Israel’s security cabinet had approved a plan for “conquering” the Gaza Strip and establishing a “sustained presence” there, Netanyahu posted a video on X in which he said Israeli soldiers would". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
